titles: A plain defence of the Protestant religion, fitted to the meanest capacity being a full confutation of the net for the fishers of men, published by two gentlemen lately gone over to the Church of Rome. Wherein is evidently made appear, that their departure from the Protestant religion was without cause of reason. Written for publick good by L. E. a son of the Church of England, as by law established.
author: L. Ä–.
Wake, William, 1657-1737, attributed name.
publisher: printed by S.L. and are to be sold by R. Taylor, near Stationers-Hall,
notes: Wing attributes this work to William Wake.
With a preliminary imprimatur leaf dated Jan. 26. 1686/7.
Reproduction of the original in the Lambeth Palace Library, London.
keywords: J. C., --  late convert. --  Net for the fisher of men and the same which Christ gave to His Apostles --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
